direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods configure a Safelist with similar tags and attributes but with different levels of permissiveness.
Both methods extend the basic Safelist configuration but with additional tags and attributes.
Both methods configure a Safelist but with different sets of allowed tags and attributes.
Both methods configure a Safelist but with different levels of permissiveness.
Both methods involve adding tags to the Safelist, but relaxed() adds a specific set of tags.
Both methods involve adding attributes to tags in the Safelist, but relaxed() adds a specific set of attributes.
Both methods involve adding protocols to attributes in the Safelist, but relaxed() adds a specific set of protocols.

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require initializing a Safelist object.
Adding tags is a prerequisite for configuring the Safelist in both methods.
Adding attributes is a prerequisite for configuring the Safelist in both methods.
Adding protocols is a prerequisite for configuring the Safelist in both methods.
Both methods need to verify if a tag is safe according to the configured Safelist.
Both methods need to verify if an attribute is safe according to the configured Safelist.
